definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: I heard the roar of the gun salute, then the sound earth-shaking.
sentences.chinese: 我听到了礼炮的轰鸣，那声音惊天动地。

sentences.english: Air gun salute profusion, blooming new smile.
sentences.chinese: 礼炮缤纷空中啸，花团锦簇新人笑。

sentences.english: The military band played the national anthems of China and Spain with 21 salutes lingering in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 在雄壮的21响礼炮声中，军乐队演奏中西两国国歌。
炮兵轰隆隆地发出十九响礼炮。

sentences.english: Eight salute to heaven and earth, let the heavens and the earth for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 八门礼炮告天地，同心同德天地久。

sentences.english: In honour of the distinguished guest they let off a salute of 21 guns.
sentences.chinese: 为向贵宾表示敬意，他们鸣礼炮21响。

sentences.english: They fired a salute of ten guns.
The captain ordered his men to fire a salute.
sentences.chinese: 船长命令部下鸣放礼炮。

sentences.english: The Queen's birthday was honoured by a 21-gun salute.
sentences.chinese: 一响礼炮庆祝女王的生日。

sentences.english: They saluted the Queen by firing ten guns.
sentences.chinese: 他们鸣礼炮十响向女王致敬。

sentences.english: Gun salute as the resounding sound of the National Day, China's military parade ceremony began.
sentences.chinese: 随着六十声国庆礼炮响彻云霄，中国阅兵仪式开始。

sentences.english: The band played the national anthems of both countries and fired 21 gun salutes.
sentences.chinese: 乐队高奏中美两国国歌，礼炮鸣21响。

sentences.english: The military band played the national anthems of the two countries and a 19-gun salute was fired.
sentences.chinese: 军乐队奏中南两国国歌，鸣礼炮19响。

sentences.english: The visiting head of state was given the honour of a twenty-one salute.
sentences.chinese: 来访的国家元首领受了二十一响礼炮的礼遇。

sentences.english: He went on to help develop the Salyuts and Progress craft and the Mir space station.
sentences.chinese: 随后，他帮助研发了礼炮号和和平号空间站。

definition: to rise to the sky/to lift off/to levitate/liftoff
sound of gunfire/fig. news of momentous events
honor guard/guard of honor/the banner bearing contingent leading a military procession
big gun/cannon/artillery/one who talks big/trad. form 大炮 also used/CL:門|门[men2],尊[zun1]
